skill.name: env-config
skill.description:
Use when setting up environment configuration, loading .env files, or managing
application settings across environments.
Triggers for: .env setup, loading environment variables, Pydantic BaseSettings,
configuration validation, or secret management.
NOT for: code-specific logic, feature flags, or runtime feature toggles.

Use when setting up environment configuration, loading .env files, or managing

skill.author: Awais68

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation and configuration management skill with minimal code execution. The verify.py script only performs static validation of markdown files using safe Python standard library functions. No network calls, no sensitive data access, no dangerous code execution patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Managing environment configuration across development, staging, and production is error-prone and insecure. This skill provides expert guidance for Pydantic-based settings, .env file management, and secure secrets handling for Python/FastAPI projects.
actual_capabilities: Create Pydantic BaseSettings classes for type-safe configuration
Load and validate .env files with proper secret handling
Set up multi-environment support (dev, staging, production)
Use SecretStr for sensitive values like API keys and passwords
Validate required configuration at application startup
Integrate with FastAPI and SQLModel for full-stack projects
limitations: Python and Pydantic only (not for Node.js, Go, or other languages)
Documentation and guidance only, does not modify files automatically
Requires manual secret generation and secure storage setup

use_cases.title: Set up project configuration
use_cases.description: Create type-safe settings classes with Pydantic that load from .env files and validate at startup.

use_cases.title: Manage multi-environment configs
use_cases.description: Configure separate settings for development, staging, and production with environment-specific overrides.

use_cases.title: Secure secrets handling
use_cases.description: Implement SecretStr for passwords and API keys to prevent accidental exposure in logs or errors.

prompt_templates.title: Basic .env setup
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I set up a .env file and load it in my FastAPI application with Pydantic settings?

prompt_templates.title: Database configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to configure PostgreSQL database URL and connection pooling using environment variables.

prompt_templates.title: Secret management
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use SecretStr in Pydantic settings to safely handle JWT secrets and database passwords?

prompt_templates.title: Production deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the best practices for environment configuration when deploying FastAPI to production?

output_examples.input: How do I set up a .env file and load it in my FastAPI application with Pydantic settings?
output: Create config/settings.py with Pydantic BaseSettings class
Define required fields with Field(..., description=...) for validation
Use SecretStr for sensitive values like JWT_SECRET_KEY
Create .env.example template with all required variables
Add .env to .gitignore to prevent accidental commits

best_practices: Use SecretStr for all passwords, API keys, tokens, and database credentials
Validate all required settings at application startup with Pydantic Field validation
Create .env.example template showing all required variables but no actual secrets
anti_patterns: Never commit .env files to version control
Never hardcode secrets in source code
Never log settings or environment variables

faq.question: Does this skill work with non-Python projects?
faq.answer: No, this skill focuses on Python/Pydantic/FastAPI. Other languages have different configuration patterns.

faq.question: What are the limits on environment variables?
faq.answer: Pydantic validates types and constraints. Large configurations should use config files loaded by the settings class.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Docker or Kubernetes?
faq.answer: Use Settings.from_env() to load environment-specific .env files or set environment variables directly in container specs.

faq.question: Is my configuration data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides documentation and guidance. Your configuration data stays on your machine.

faq.question: Why is my validation failing?
faq.answer: Check that all required fields have Field(..., description=...) and that your .env file contains all defined variables.

faq.question: How does this compare to other config approaches?
faq.answer: Pydantic BaseSettings provides type safety and validation. It works alongside .env files, environment variables, and secrets managers.
